```{r}
#Exercise 1
n <- 0
if (n > 1) {
  print("Larger")
}else{
  print("Equal or smaller")
}


#Exercise 2
if (n > 1) {
  print("Larger")
}else if(n == 1){
  print("Equal")
}else{
  print("Smaller")
}

#Exercise 3
# Die Funktion %% (Modulo) gibt den Rest einer Teilung wieder --> Teilung durch 2 mit Rest 1 --> Zahl ungerade
if(n%%2 == 1) {
  print("Odd")
}else{
  print("Even")
}

#Exercise 4
for(n in c(-1,1,2)){
  if (n > 1) {
  print("Larger")
}else if(n == 1){
  print("Equal")
}else{
  print("Smaller")
}
}

#Exercise 5
v <- vector(mode = "character")
l <- vector(mode = "numeric", length = 1)
for(n in c(-1,1,2)){
  l <- l + 1
  if (n > 1) {
  v[l] <- "Larger"
}else if(n == 1){
  v[l] <- "Equal"
}else{
  v[l] <- "Smaller"
}
}
print(v)


#Exercise 6
li <- list()
z <- vector(mode = "numeric", length = 1)
for(n in c(-1,1,2)){
  z <- z + 1
  if (n > 1) {
  li[[z]] <- "Larger"
}else if(n == 1){
  li[[z]] <- "Equal"
}else{
  li[[z]] <- "Smaller"
}
}
print(li)



#Exercise 7
list <- lapply(c(-1,1,2), function(z){
  if (z > 1) {
  res <- "Larger"
}else if(z == 1){
  res <- "Equal"
}else{
  res <- "Smaller"
}
  return(res)
})
print(list)

#Exercise 8
print(unlist(list))


```
